identificationModule.briefTitle: Traxi Panniculus Retractor for Cesarean Delivery
identificationModule.officialTitle: Randomized Controlled Trial of Panniculus Retraction Methods for Cesarean Delivery

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This prospective, open-label, randomized-controlled trial is designed to evaluate the use of the Traxi panniculus retractor-- a commercially available Class I FDA-exempt device will improve surgical outcomes, cardiopulmonary function, and provider/patient satisfaction in morbidly obese women undergoing cesarean delivery.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Morbidly obese women (BMI \>/= 40) undergoing non-emergent cesarean delivery will be recruited and randomized to Traxi panniculus retraction or standard of care for panniculus retraction.

The primary outcome evaluated will be operating time (incision to closure). Other secondary outcomes related to surgery including estimated blood loss, surgical site infection, and number of scrubbed personnel.

A secondary aim of the study is to evaluate the hypothesis that the Traxi retraction device reduces chestwall compression panniculus retraction and will improve intraoperative pulmonary function. To do this, the investigators will measure the difference in individual participant pulmonary function tests (forced vital capacity, forced expiratory volume) before and after panniculus retraction using a bedside spirometer.

A tertiary aim of the study is to evaluate the hypothesis that the Traxi retraction device will improve patient and provider satisfaction due to improved delivery experience and maintaining patient dignity. Patient and provider-reported outcomes will be evaluated using surveys.

armGroups.label: Traxi panniculus retraction group
armGroups.description: The method of panniculus retraction will be the Traxi panniculus retraction (Clinical Innovations, LLC) by the provider.
interventionNames: Device: Traxi panniculus retraction (Clinical Innovations, LLC)

armGroups.label: Standard of care
armGroups.description: Standard methods of panniculus retraction as determined by individual provider (including medical taping, extra personnel for retraction)

interventions.name: Traxi panniculus retraction (Clinical Innovations, LLC)
interventions.description: class I, FDA-exempt, commercially available for use in panniculus retraction during cesarean delivery or other laparotomy

primaryOutcomes.description: time from skin incision to closure during cesarean delivery
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in pulmonary function (forced vital capacity)
secondaryOutcomes.description: measure difference in pulmonary function tests (FVC=forced vital capacity) before and after application of panniculus retraction method
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in pulmonary function (forced expiratory volume)
secondaryOutcomes.description: measure difference in pulmonary function tests (FEV1=forced expiratory volume in 1 minute) before and after application of panniculus retraction method
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Patient satisfaction assessed by a questionnaire
secondaryOutcomes.description: patient-reported outcomes regarding surgery and delivery will be obtained using a survey made by the research team with a four level likert scale
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

secondaryOutcomes.description: provider-reported outcomes regarding surgery will be obtained using survey with an eleven level likert scale
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

otherOutcomes.description: estimated blood loss reported on operative report
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

otherOutcomes.description: review of medical records for 6 weeks postpartum to evaluate for wound opening or infection rates
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

otherOutcomes.measure: Number of personnel involved in cesarean
otherOutcomes.description: recorded number of scrubbed personnel needed to assist with surgery
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks
through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

otherOutcomes.description: composite rate of neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) admission, 5-minute Apgar score \<7)
otherOutcomes.timeFrame: through study completion, approximately 6 to 8 weeks

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Pregnant
* BMI greater than or equal to 40 kg/m\^2
* Undergoing non-emergent cesarean delivery
* Able and willing to provide written, informed consent
* Singleton gestation

Exclusion Criteria:

* Fetal demise
* Disruption of abdominal skin (infection, rash, abrasion, laceration)
* Known adhesive allergy
